thread.title: Adelaide Fringe Parade kicks off proceedings for 2017 with lights and glitter
thread.title_full: Adelaide Fringe Parade kicks off proceedings for 2017 with lights and glitter

title: Adelaide Fringe Parade kicks off proceedings for 2017 with lights and glitter
text:
Adelaide Fringe Parade kicks off proceedings for 2017 with lights and glitter Posted  13:57 Map: Adelaide 5000 
More than 80 luminous floats lit up North Terrace in Adelaide on Saturday night to kick off the Adelaide Fringe Festival. 
Tens of thousands of people lined the streets to watch the Fringe Parade as it made its way from King William Street to Frome Road. External Link: @kymdruitt video-tweet: Fringe parade! #adelaidefringe 
The 2017 Adelaide Fringe runs until March 19 and is one component in the city's Mad March festival season, which also includes the Adelaide Festival, Adelaide Writer's Week, Womadelaide, and the Clipsal 500. 
It is the second largest annual arts festival in the world after the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in Scotland. 
Adelaide Fringe Festival director Heather Croall used the opening weekend to announce the State Government had injected $1 million into next year's festival to abolish inside charges for artists selling tickets less than $35. 
Artists currently pay a levy to the festival on their ticket sales, called inside costs. 
The Government said abolishing that levy would provide an incentive for artists to keep their tickets under $35 and encourage the public to go to more shows. 
The money would also be used to halve the inside cost for tickets priced above that. 
Ms Croall said it would make the festival more affordable for artists, audiences and venues. 
"It's brilliant news for artists all over the world and Adelaide artists, interstate and international artists who have considered that the Adelaide Fringe is too expensive for them can now come and sign up and do a season," she said. 
The Government said the money would also be used for an interstate marketing campaign targeting other states. 
It said the 2016 Fringe resulted in gross economic expenditure of about $77 million.
